content.description: Neat climbing.
content.location: Right of Irish Inche....kinda on different face...check out the topo.

content.description: Climb up blocks to a nice crux, then beautiful stone to the top.
content.location: Just outside The Cellar, around the corner to the right.

content.description: Super chill climbing for bottom half....then high crux....some people stay left....some people bank right around arete....little tougher to stay left....but do what ever is funner.
content.location: Right most route in The Pub.

climbs.name: Ten OZ Draft
climbs.fa: Bryan Zittlosen, JBaker, EFR, ERU, June 2018

content.description: The technical crux is the first 15 feet.  Then a short slab walk leads to a bulge, then up nice rock to an unusual finish.
content.protection: Bolts with Mussy anchor.  A cabledraw on the 3rd bolt aids cleaning.
content.location: Just right of the PUB is another steep section with a slab running up to it.  This is the left-most route in that area.  It starts 10 feet or so right of the start of Triple Stout.

content.description: Steep and burly...low crux with high redpoint crux.
content.location: Left most route on steep face (The Pub).

content.description: Fun!
content.location: second route from the left on the short upper wall.

content.description:
Super-steep roped bouldering. A sweet little gem of a problem. 

  Recommend that belayer use the keeper bolt to avoid getting pulled into the fall line. A 3-foot sling (or chain of draws) is about right.  

  Stick clip the 1st bolt is okay, 2nd is cheating.
content.protection:
5 bolts and Mussys. Plus a keeper bolt for belayer. (3.75 x 3/8 SS) 

  2nd bolt is 5 x 1/2 SS
content.location: The LEFT-HAND route in The Cellar, a 45-degree overhang about 120 feet right of The Pub.

content.description: This unusual little route may be the steepest 5.10 on the mountain. 3 overhangs separated by overlaps with full recovery rests mean the climbing is somewhat strenuous but not pumpy.
content.protection:
11 bolts plus Mussys. 

  Short QDs are a bad idea on this route...they'll only buy you rope drag.  But then  short QDs are a bad idea in general.   

  AND...probably a good idea to CHAIN 2 DRAWS TOGETHER at the keeper bolt (4th bolt...on big block before the steepness starts) to avoid rope drag.
content.location: Starts on the slab to the right of THE PUB.  3 bolts on the slab get you up to the keeper bolt at the start of the first overhang.

content.description: Fun!
content.location: Left most route on this short upper wall.

content.description: Fun!
content.location: Third route from the left on the upper short wall.

content.description:
The Pub Crawl is the grand, obvious linkup of all three routes in the Pub.  Starting on Special Brew, climb through the crux to join Corned Beef and Thrash at the shared clipping jug.  Continue up Corned Beef and Thrash until an obvious traverse right deposits you at the high crux of Triple Stout and finishes on that route. 

  The Pub Crawl incorporates all of the best climbing on all 3 routes and the cruxes of both Special Brew and Triple Stout.  It might be a little soft for the 12+ grade but it doesn't make sense to have a route that incorporates two solid 12 cruxes plus additional pump and still only rate it mid 12.  We'll see where the consensus puts this one.
content.protection: Lots of bolts to the chain anchor on Triple Stout (may have lower off biners).  Stick clipping the first 2 on Special Brew may be a good idea, as they are hard to clip otherwise.  Tricky to clean due to its consistently overhung and somewhat traversing nature.
content.location: Starts on Special Brew 5.12 (the leftmost route at The Pub) and finishes on Triple Stout (the rightmost line at The Pub).

content.description: Casual "approach" climbing to the roof jugfest.
content.location: Right route in the big roof....just right of Hanging Harps.

content.description: Great warm up....very casual jug hauling.
content.location: Second route from left....starts in roof.

content.description: Low crux....casual after that.
content.location: First route as you come in.

content.description: Fun!
content.location: Just right of Whiskey on Sunday...starts in some quartz bands.

content.description: Fun! Need some good foot work.
content.location: Right most route on upper short wall.

content.description: Fun low angle climbing to neat roof section on bomber holds....bring some slings to reduce rope drag through roofs.
content.location: Left route in the big roof.

content.description:
Super-steep roped bouldering.  Very fun. A bit easier and more straight-forward than Secret In The Cellar. 

  Recommend that belayer use the keeper bolt to avoid getting pulled into the fall line. A 3-foot sling (or chain of draws) is about right.  

  Stick clip of 2nd bolt is cheating. 

  Not at all sure of rating.
content.protection: 4 bolts and Mussys. Plus a keeper bolt for belayer. (3.75 x 3/8 SS)
content.location: The RIGHT-HAND route in The Cellar, a 45-degree overhang 120 ft right of The Pub.

content.description: Fun variation to Luckily Unlucky....branches right.
content.location: Branches right on Luckily Unlucky at third bolt.

climbs.name: ExtraVertical Activity
climbs.fa: JBaker, JWodraska, Mike Kane, Myk Brown et al, June 2018

content.description: Up a pleasant slab for 4 bolts to an overhanging arete.  Climb the arete to a full rest, then launch out left on the steep handrail, then up the steep final section. Cool holds, steep, FUN.The route both overhangs and traverses, so cleaning would be a bitch if it did not have cabledraws.Cleaning the bottom 5 draws is pretty easy on TR. Leader cleans last bolt and lowers, then someone ties in to other side of rope while it is through the anchor and TRs (5.9 - 5.10) to get the bottom draws.
content.protection: 11 bolts + mussy anchor.  Bolts 6 thru 10 have cabledraws.
content.location: Right of the Pub, and right of Rice Pudding

content.description: Crux at 4th bolt....rest of route you can campus to impress the ladies....or fellas.
content.location: Center line in The Pub.

climbs.name: Belfast Breakfast
climbs.fa: Anders Zway, Gabby Brunt, Jessica Willy

content.description: Proper fun warm up.
content.location: Just right of Gingers Welcome.

climbs.name: Back Crack
climbs.fa: JBaker, Bryan Zittlosen, Matt Barr, Miguel Pineda, July, 2018

content.description:
A thoughtful slab for 3 bolts, then an overhanging crack for 5 bolts. Bolts are fairly closely spaced so you don't impact the slab if you blow a clip.

 When I first got on this route to see if it was worth doing and mark bolt placements, it seemed really easy. Like 5.9. When I did the FA run (blazing sun, no warmup) it seemed like 5.11. Based on that and the struggles I've seen other folks have, I'm saying it is at least 10+.
content.protection: 8 bolts and an anchor comprised of the new super-beautiful ClimbTech Mussys donated by Bryan Zittlosen.
content.location: Right of the Cellar is an area I call the Back Room. Tullamore Dew is on the far left side of the Back Room, just outside (south of) the super-steep Cellar. This route is about 20 feet right of Tullamore Dew.

content.description: Gets morning shade.....same elevation as The Steep. This long-ish wall consists of three separate areas:Left end - where most of the moderates are locatedThe Pub- really nice steep wall with some independent lines and linkupsThe Cellar - Steep roped bouldering
